channel.title: Talawanda High School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Talawanda High School, including events, athletics, clubs, and important dates.

item.title: Food Resources for Talawanda School Families
item.description:
Talawanda School District offers multiple food assistance resources for families in need: - Little Free Pantries available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or more as needed - Backpack Program in all elementary buildings provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays (contact building Social Worker) - Emergency Food boxes available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours - Additional resources include a calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule, a list of all Butler County food pantries, and SNAP information

View original newsletter

item.title: Little Women: The Musical Performances
item.description:
Talawanda High School Drama Club presents Little Women: The Musical, a Broadway adaptation of Louisa May Alcott's 1868 story about the four March sisters during the Civil War. The production features nearly 20 THS students from all grade levels and Oxford community members. Performances: December 5th at 7 PM, December 6th at 2 PM and 7 PM at the Talawanda High School Performing Arts Center. Tickets are $8 and can be purchased online or at the door.

Little Women: The Musical (Evening Performance)

item.title: Club Meetings Schedule December 1-6
item.description:
No club meetings during Thanksgiving week. Club meetings resume December 1-6 with various options: - Monday 12/1: Diversity Club, Setting Stone, Tribune - Tuesday 12/2: Art Club, Diversity Club, Key Club (tutorial time), Mock Trial, Robotics Club - Thursday 12/4: Chess Club, Mock Trial, Project Green, Robotics Club - Friday-Saturday 12/5-6: Drama Production of Little Women at PAC (7pm Friday; 2pm & 7pm Saturday)

item.title: Butler Tech Application Window Now Open
item.description:
Butler Tech's application window is open for 1-Year, 2-Year, and 3-Year programs. Prospective students can attend Small Group Tours (9AM-12PM) for 2Y programs on Dec 6, Dec 13, Jan 24, and Jan 31, or for 3Y programs on Jan 31, Feb 7, and Feb 28. Open Houses (4-7 PM) will be held Jan 15, 2026 (all 2Y campuses: BSC, DRL, NSC, SOA) and March 5, 2026 (all 3Y campuses: AM Hub, Aviation, BSC, DRL). Apply here | More details

Butler Tech Small Group Tours - 2Y Programs

item.title: Senior Yearbook Portrait Submission Information
item.description:
Seniors must submit their portraits for the 2026 yearbook by March 27th. Upload photos at snap.yearbookforever.com using access code talawanda2026. Photos must be in portrait format (not landscape), greater than 1MB file size, follow student code of conduct, and black and white photos are discouraged.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Senior Cap and Gown Order Deadline
item.description:
Senior cap and gown orders must be placed by December 6th to receive the reduced price of $66.69. After this deadline, the price increases to $65.00 plus service/shipping and sales tax. Orders can be placed online at JOSTENS.COM or through in-school ordering during lunch (dates TBD). The gown is a rental; students keep their cap, tassel, and stole, which must be returned after graduation. Contact Jostens at (513) 561-3225 or tannerj@jostens.com for questions.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Finals Week Schedule December 16-19
item.description:
Finals Week runs December 16-19, 2025. Students should arrive by 11:10 AM on 12/17, 12/18, and 12/19, and only need to attend classes with exams. Buses depart at 2:30 PM daily.

Tuesday 12/16: Full day schedule with 0 Bell (7:30-7:50), regular periods, and 7th Period Exam (1:00-2:30 PM).

Wednesday 12/17: 1st Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40), 2nd Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

Thursday 12/18: 3rd Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40), 4th Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

Friday 12/19: 5th Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40), 6th Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

Finals Week

item.title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
item.description:
Individual Testing (12/3-12/5): For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking the class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

Class Testing (12/16-12/19): Only for students currently taking Algebra C or Government classes, administered during exam week. Make-up testing available 1/7-1/8.

Emails with specific test information and scheduling will be sent to students and parents before Thanksgiving Break. Questions should be directed to Mrs. Hess at hessb@talawanda.org.

item.title: Community Food Resources and Support Services
item.description:
Talawanda School District Food Resources:

  • Little Free Pantries available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or more as needed
  • Backpack Program in all elementary buildings - small bag of food provided each week on Thursdays/Fridays (contact your building Social Worker)
  • Emergency Food boxes available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours
  • Additional resources include a calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule, list of all Butler County food pantries, and SNAP information

Contact your building Social Worker for assistance accessing these programs.

View original newsletter

item.title: FCCLA Diaper Drive for Families in Need
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting a Diaper Drive from November 3 to December 12 with a goal of collecting 1,000 diapers and 21 packs of wipes for families in need. Donations can be dropped off at THS, Room 611 or delivered directly via Amazon, Walmart, etc. to: Talawanda High School, ATTN: FCCLA Kari Croucher, 5301 University Park Blvd., Oxford, OH 45056. The drive is TSD approved for distribution.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Robotics Club Scrimmage at Loveland High School
item.description:
The Robotics Club will compete in a scrimmage at Loveland High School on Sunday, November 16th. The scrimmage starts at 1:00 pm, but all members must arrive by 12:30 pm.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Finals Week Schedule and Transportation Information
item.description:
Finals week runs Tuesday, December 16 - Friday, December 19. Students should arrive by 11:10 AM on 12/17, 12/18, and 12/19, and only need to attend classes with scheduled exams. Buses depart at 2:30 PM daily.

Exam Schedule: - Tuesday 12/16: Full day schedule (0 Bell through 6th period), 7th period exam 1:00-2:30 PM - Wednesday 12/17: 1st period exam 7:55-9:25 AM, break, 2nd period exam 9:40-11:10 AM - Thursday 12/18: 3rd period exam 7:55-9:25 AM, break, 4th period exam 9:40-11:10 AM - Friday 12/19: 5th period exam 7:55-9:25 AM, break, 6th period exam 9:40-11:10 AM

Finals Week - Tuesday Schedule with 7th Period Exam

item.title: Community Meals, Food Pantries, and SNAP Information
item.description:
Talawanda School District provides access to several food assistance resources: - Calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule - Shows when and where free community meals are available - Complete list of Butler County food pantries - Directory of all local food pantries in the area - SNAP (food assistance) information - Details about applying for government food assistance benefits

Additional resources include Little Free Pantries at all TSD buildings (restocked weekly), Backpack Program at elementary schools (food provided Thursdays/Fridays), and emergency food boxes available within 24 hours.

View original newsletter

item.title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
item.description:
PUSH Program provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, contact Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/.

View original newsletter

item.title: FCCLA Hosts Annual Veterans Day Breakfast
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting the Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd. Oxford, Ohio 45056). Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM followed by an assembly at 9:00 AM. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. RSVP approval is required - please scan the QR code or email croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch of service, and total number attending.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
item.description:
BRAVE Day is Talawanda High School's annual family building, diversity, and anti-bullying event for sophomores only, taking place Friday, November 14th. The day focuses on helping students realize they're not alone and building community through sharing stories, activities, and listening. Students participate voluntarily and are encouraged to attend, but those who feel they would not benefit may stay in their regular classes instead.

View original newsletter

item.title: Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting the Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, OH 45056). Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM and the assembly at 9:00 AM. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. RSVP required - scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch, and total number attending. Event sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: FCCLA Blood Drive - Save Lives
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting a blood drive on November 7, 2025 from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at the Talawanda Intermediate Auxiliary Gym. The drive addresses the American blood shortage and helps those needing blood for illnesses, transplants, and other medical needs. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate. Free snacks and 1 hour of rest provided. TSD approved for distribution. For more information: +513-273-3200 or CROUCHERK@TALAWANDA.ORG

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Club Meetings Schedule for November 3-7
item.description:
Weekly club meetings scheduled November 3-7: - Monday, Nov 3: Diversity Club (room 400), Setting Stone (room 320), Tribune (room 315) - all at 2:30pm - Tuesday, Nov 4: NO SCHOOL for students; Mock Trial 5:00pm-7:00pm (room 315) - Wednesday, Nov 5: Robotics Club 2:30pm-4:00pm (room 412, all welcome) - Thursday, Nov 6: Best Buddies Tutorial (Cafeteria), Chess Club (room 603), Key Club Tutorial (room 218), Mock Trial (room 315), Project Green (room 224), Robotics Club (room 412) - Friday, Nov 7: Drama 2:30pm-5:30pm (PAC)

Individual Testing (12/3-12/5): For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking that class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.
